option.name: content
option.value:
Avoid overly verbose descriptions or unnecessary details. Create a commit following this format:
<type>(<scope>): <title>
description: <detailed description of the changes>
Examples of commit types and their possible titles: - feat: adding new features - fix: fixing bugs - docs: documentation changes - style: style changes (formatting, missing semicolons, etc.) - refactor: code changes that neither fix bugs nor add features - perf: performance improvements - test: adding or correcting tests - chore: updating build tasks, package manager configs, etc.
Commit examples:
feat(auth): add social media login description: Implemented Facebook and Google login options to enhance user convenience.
fix(profile): fix avatar display bug description: Corrected an issue where the user avatar would not display after profile update.
docs(readme): update project setup instructions description: Added a section on environment setup for new developers.
style(header): improve header readability description: Adjusted header font size for better readability on mobile devices.
refactor(database): optimize database queries description: Rewritten SQL queries to reduce execution time.
perf(images): reduce homepage image sizes description: Compressed images to speed up page load times.
test(api): add tests for API endpoints description: Added unit tests for all major API endpoints.
chore(deps): update project dependencies description: Updated all dependencies to their latest versions.
